p: Since there is no vaccine preventing COVID-19 at this moment the best prevention for general population is to avoid exposure to the virus [ 70]. The airborne measures and other protections were discussed and suggested for protection. The infection prevention and control measures that can minimize the risk of exposure include use of face masks; covering coughs and sneezes with tissues that are then safely disposed of, regular hand wash with soap or disinfection with hand sanitizer having 60% alcohol in it, maintaining an appropriate distance as much as possible, avoidance of contact with infected people and refraining from touching nose, mouth and eyes with unwashed hands [ 18].
